instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00426 chiming but black screen
threads.message:
Hi friends,

I just got in this device. No damage no liquid spill to see.

it is starting, chiming but nothing to see. External screen is black as well.

First I checked the  display. On another machine the display is working good. So Display and Display cable is good.

then I checked for L9410 and L9330, both 0.91V

L8300 has 0V both sides, J8300 Pin 5 has 0V , R8338 has 0V on both sides.

SMC_Lid is 0V

FL8300, 8301,8302 and 8303 are ok.

Need a bit help,

threads.title: 820-00426 chiming but black screen
threads.message: Any USB activity? Definitely no liquid or drop damage? CPU VCore present?

threads.title: 820-00426 chiming but black screen
threads.message:
"SMC_Lid is 0V"
Check why.

Disconnect any perypheral device which access this signal.
Check for corrosion around Hall sensor.

threads.title: 820-00426 chiming but black screen
threads.message:
ok, the Lid is working good. I measured on pin 30 J4801 but that is ground, there are 2 pins together, so now its clear. pin 28 is 3.42V opened laptop and 0V closed, that is ok.

@[B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/1153-johnb8812"]JohnB8812[/URL][/B] VPU Vcore should be present if its chiming I think. I measured on L7310, L7320 and L7330 1.82V, USB is active as well

threads.title: 820-00426 chiming but black screen
threads.message: Are you getting backlight with no image or no image and no backlight?

threads.title: 820-00426 chiming but black screen
threads.message:
Then your problem is not on the backlight circuit.
You should get image first.

You must get 5V at pins 28-30/J8300 in the first few seconds; even without LCD connected.
At the same time, LCD_HPD should go high; requires internal LCD connected.
If not, PCH will not recognize the internal screen.

threads.title: 820-00426 chiming but black screen
threads.message: thanks for help. a pity but I still want to try that advice from 2informaticos but customer came in to get the macbook back.
